column1: Mongolian blue spots are common among persons who are of Asian, Native American, Hispanic, East Indian, and African descent.
Mongolian spots are not cancerous and are not associated with disease.

The markings are usually: - Blue or blue-gray spots on the back, buttocks, base of spine, shoulders, or other body areas - Flat with irregular shape and unclear edges - Normal in skin texture - 2 to 8 centimeters wide, or larger Mongolian blue spots are sometimes mistaken for bruises.
If the spots are a sign of an underlying disorder, treatment for that problem will likely be recommended.
